parse.title: Kalphite Queen
parse.text:
Kalphite Queen
This article is about the regular Kalphite Queen. For the exiled version, see Exiled Kalphite Queen.
For the achievement, see Kalphite Queen (achievement).
This article has a strategy guide.
All information on mechanics, setups, and tactics is on the subpage.

The Kalphite Queen (Kalphiscarabeinae pasha) is a powerful kalphite and the queen of the kalphites that live in the Kalphite Hive. Players can encounter her if they enter the lowest chamber in the hive.

Obtaining all unique drops will unlock the [Name] the Queenslayer title.

If assigned the Kalphite Queen for a Reaper Task, the Exiled Kalphite Queen may be killed instead.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Main article: Kalphite Hive
Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Kalphite Hive333None1Maplink

The entrance to the Kalphite hive is due west of Shantay Pass (see Kalphite Hive § Getting there). New visitors to the hive will require a rope to climb down the hive. A second rope will also be required for entrance into the queen's room.

Once inside, the queen's chambers can be found by navigating through the tunnel. The entrance to her room is guarded by two kalphite guardians. There is a tunnel entrance in the centre of this room. It has two options: "Quick-Climb", which will send players into the world encounter without any additional dialogue, and "Climb down", which prompts players to either enter the world encounter or create a private instance. See the Kalphite hive map below.

An instance can be created for a base cost of 100,000 coins. A Kalphite Queen instance can hold up to 200 players, can have a custom spawn timer, and can be done in practice mode.

The open world encounter for the Kalphite Queen has several potato cactus spawns. A private instance is initially empty and contains no item spawns.

The fight[edit | edit source]

The Kalphite Queen has two forms, both with 40,000 life points and unique immunities. Both forms have the same attacks and abilities. When her first form is lowered to 0 life points, she will collapse to the ground and moult from her skin and take to the air. Killing the first form does not yield experience or affect kill count. When her second form is lowered to 0 life points, the queen will die, leaving drops on the ground.

In her first form, she is immune to magic and ranged damage , leaving only melee or necromancy attacks available as an option. In her second form, she receives immunity to melee attacks, but can be damaged by magic, ranged, and necromancy. Combat familiars can damage both of her forms with any style.

The Kalphite Queen has 3 basic attacks:

  • Bite, a basic melee attack. Unlike her other attacks, this attack can miss.
  • Lightning, a magic attack that can bounce between targets. This attack has 100% accuracy against all players.
  • Spines, a ranged attack that also drains prayer points by 10. This attack has 100% accuracy against all players.

In addition to her standard attacks, the Kalphite Queen has the ability to spawn aggressive kalphite workers from the cocoons on the outer wall. She will only spawn them if she is within 10 squares of the cocoons. Each cocoon can spawn a kalphite worker multiple times.

If a dwarf multicannon or its upgraded variant is set up anywhere in the arena the queen will destroy it. You will get the note "Your cannon has self-destructed! Claim a new one from Nulodion, south of Ice Mountain."

When killed, the kalphite guardians and any kalphite workers summoned to assist her will also die off.

Achievements[edit | edit source]

Main article: Kalphite Queen achievements
  • Hail to the Queen ( 20) – Defeat two Kalphite Guardians whilst fighting Kalphite Queen and then defeat her. Can only be completed in a solo instance.
  • Checkmate ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from the Kalphite Queen.
  • Kalphite Queen ( 0) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/1)
  • Nipped in the Bug ( 15) – Use a dreadnip on the Kalphite Queen.
  • Sand in My Loot ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within the Kharidian desert.
    • Dragon chainbody drop
  • Bug Swatter:
    • Bug Swatter I ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/5)
    • Bug Swatter II ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/10)
    • Bug Swatter III ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/25)
    • Bug Swatter IV ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/50)
    • Bug Swatter V ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/75)
    • Bug Swatter VI ( 5) – Defeat the Kalphite Queen. (X/100)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 11 January 2021 (Update):
    • Various bosses around RuneScape have taken their Santa Hats off for another year.
  • patch 27 January 2020 (Update):
    • A kill timer is now available at Kalphite Queen and the Corporeal Beast.
  • patch 12 August 2019 (Update):
    • Kalphite Queen will now despawn her Kalphite Guardians when killed in an instance.
  • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
    • Improved respawn rates for Exiled Kalphites.
  • patch 16 March 2015 (Update):
    • It is now possible to use surge in the Kalphite Queen boss instances.
  • patch 5 January 2015 (Update):
    • The Kalphite Queen (plus Exiled) no longer drops oyster pearls in an unnoted form.
  • patch 15 September 2014 (Update):
    • An animation issue has been corrected with worker cocoons that hatch during the Kalphite Queen fight.
  • update 7 September 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Kalphite Queen is level 98 during the Love Story cutscene.
  • When the Kalphite Queen was first released, she only used two attack styles: magic and melee. A ranged attack was added to prevent players from camping her with little or no risk.
  • Prior to the Evolution of Combat, the Kalphite Queen's "prayers" provided increased defence, rather than full immunity.
  • The Kalphite Queen's drops were greatly improved after the Kalphite King was released.
  • Both of the Queen's forms are similar to the life cycle of the cicada. She starts off as a beetle, then moults into an airborne insect.
  • It was revealed in the April 2011 BTS that the Kalphite Queen and the King Black Dragon were due to be married on 29 April 2011, to coincide with the wedding of Prince William Windsor and Catherine Middleton in the UK.
  • Kalphite Queen is included in RuneScape Top Trumps.
  • On 12 September 2016 Kalphite Queen received the ability to attack players who stand under her.
  • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this boss was 7,370 kills.[2]
    • This had increased to 9,467 by 13 December 2018.[3]
  • Kalpite Queen's scientific name is likely derived from two real-life sources: Carabidae, the scientific name for ground beetles, and pasha, a title in some Islamic cultures.
  • She is the second-oldest lootable boss, preceded by the King Black Dragon.
